name: nutrient supply from poultry manure, dried | organic nitrogen fertiliser, as N | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22464/documentation

This inventory describes the supply of nutrients from ''poultry manure, dried'' for fertiliser use.;No machinery expenditures or emissions to the environment are considered related to the actual application of this substance on soil during its agricultural use. The purpose of this activity is to connect the chemical production of ''poultry manure, dried'' with its generic uses as fertilizer. The product ''poultry manure, dried'' is connected to the generic market for 'organic nitrogen fertiliser, as N' and 'organic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' and 'organic potassium fertiliser, as K2O' through this supplying activity. In the agricultural context, ''poultry manure, dried'' can be used directly as a fertilizer input to crop production, eventually with other chemicals; alternatively, a generic input of 'organic nitrogen fertiliser, as N' and 'organic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' and 'organic potassium fertiliser, as K2O' can be used instead, and this will represent the regional consumption mix for his type of nutrient. A way in between is allowed by using the generic input 'organic nitrogen fertiliser, as N' and 'organic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' and 'organic potassium fertiliser, as K2O' and link to the activity providing it from a specific chemical.;In all cases, emissions associated to the application of the fertilizer have to be calculated in the crop production activity.

This inventory describes the supply of nutrients from ''poultry manure, dried'' for fertiliser use.

No machinery expenditures or emissions to the environment are considered related to the actual application of this substance on soil during its agricultural use.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Inventory based on composition of ''poultry manure, dried''.

exchanges.description: Literature data. Source nutrient content: Ecoinvent report 15. Agriculture. Pg 96, Tab 9.1 (Nemecek 2007) Information on heavy metals taken from Nemecek T. & Schnetzer J. (2011) Methods of assessment of direct field emissions for LCIs of agricultural production systems. Data v3.0 (2012). Accessible in the database report section under the name '01 crop production-direct field emissions natural resources v1.2.pdf'. Nitrogen was set as the reference product as considered the key nutrient in manure (Penn State Agronomy Guide 2015-2016. Retrieved from: http://extension.psu.edu/agronomy-guide/cm/sec2/sec29c, accessed 17th March 2016) References: Nemecek T., Kägi T. and Blaser S. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Agricultural Production Systems. Final report ecoinvent v2.0 No.15. Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH. Nemecek T. & Schnetzer J. (2011) Methods of assessment of direct field emissions for LCIs of agricultural production systems. Data v3.0 (2012)
